content.description:
Both pitches have some minor choss sections but the pro is good and overall climbs well.

P-1 (5.10b) 75 feet: Great finger crack with lieback and stem moves, past 2 bolts up higher. Plenty of good gear placements

P-2 (5.9) - 60 feet: Right of the ancher make a long reach into the thin crack to get small cams and wires. Pull through the roof on large holds then up to a large ledge.
content.location: 3/4 of the way up the lefthand gully of Hinterland on the south facing wall is this obvious finger crack going through a small roof.

content.description:
Straight up jam crack, in the book it finishes in the right crack but I found staying in the left crack quite enjoyable albeit a little dirty.

Pitch 2 heads up and right from a bolted belay with rings.
content.location: Right side of wall, starts at abvious bush with a crack straight above it.

content.description:
Didnt do P1 but it starts left of Lederhosen and then joins it near the top.

P2, cool corner system to a small roof, step left, layback and clip a bolt, some tough moves to gain small pedestal and second bolt, than an awkward step left to a chain anchor.
content.location: P1 starts middle of the wall, P2 is obvious right facing corner to small roof.

climbs.name: He Said, She Said
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Frank Bentwood, and Kelly Vaught, August 2003

content.description: First half not so great, gain a small corner with a bolt than do some zig zagging to a two bolt rap anchor, belay here or keep going through three more bolts, spicy to clip the second bolt of those three (4 bolts total). Still some more tricky moves through some overlaps.
content.location: Right side of crag, prominant arete.

content.description: Starts on second tier at a bolted anchor (mis-marked in Best Of book, the anchor is one ledge higher than noted). Tricky moves but on good jugs and flakes, maybe a loose piece here and there. Finish at a rap anchor, same anchor for Hinterland Crack (11b).
content.location: Left side of second tier, short crack flake system.

climbs.name: Community Property
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Frank Bentwood, and Kelly Vaught, August 2003.

content.description:
Begin just right of Lederhosen and climb cracks in a left-facing corner system up to the ledge and 2-bolt anchor shared with He Said She Said.

Descent: Rap 100 feet to a 2-bolt anchor, then make another 100-foot rap to the base.
content.location: Right side of the main Hinterland Wall sector.
